sentence: Why did the african child die while choking on rice? because he had malaria
explanation: explanation: To die refers to the cessation of life, while in another context, it can mean to follow a path towards something (i.e., figuratively dying for something)
first_new_sentence: The patient was gravely ill and faced the possibility to die.
second_new_sentence: Many artists would die to have the opportunity to showcase their work in that gallery.

sentence: Whats the difference between an irish wedding and an irish funeral? one person.
explanation: explanation: Die in this context refers to the end of a life in a funeral setting, whereas it could also refer to the seriousness or death of a party or fun atmosphere at a wedding
first_new_sentence: The doctor advised that without immediate treatment, she would likely die.
second_new_sentence: After the party, it felt like the mood had died.
